column4: I think its flash. Cause in chromium flash is actually what jumps to 140% of cpu

I found FF3.5 to be crashy and a cpu hog on my setup , besides not rendering some pages properly , so I switched to chromium-browser which runs very efficiently now and can import all of your bookmarks which makes less painful
right chromium does run better but the fact is this surge of resource usage only happens in flash which didn't happen before and it definitely didn't randomly stop playing audio.
chromium handles flash better than the new FF
